page.title: 05BERE FERRERS RAILWAY LINK
page.content: Bere Ferrers is on the Plymouth - Gunnislake line.Fourteen trains a day stop at Bere Ferrers, linking it with towns near the peninsula. It is a single track railway. The station at Bere Ferrers is unmanned and has been sold to be converted to holiday flats. At one time the railway company had two holiday coaches in the station yard. By the station is a very large old shed and a raised platform.In past years, fruit growers from the area would load their fruit onto trucks from the raised platform. This would then be taken by train to catch the early Covent Garden market. Nowadays it is impossible to send unaccompanied goods on the line and passenger space is limited on the new coaches. Bere Ferrers needs its railway link and either closure or conversion to a motorway would be untenable .
